stimulusHtml:
Figure 1. A food chain in the North Pacific Ocean

Based on Figure 1, which of the following is the most likely short-term effect of a decrease in the killer whale population?
choicesHtml: The sea otter and kelp populations will increase, while the sea urchin population will decrease.
The sea otter and sea urchin populations will increase, while the kelp population will decrease.
The sea otter population will stay the same, while the sea urchin and kelp populations will increase.
There will be no change to the sea otter, sea urchin, and kelp populations because another predator species will fill the niche previously occupied by the killer whales.
